intro: Tephrosia longipes var. lissocarpa, commonly known as the silky tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features compound leaves with lanceolate or ovate leaflets and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in terminal clusters. Its flowers are followed by elongated, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to humid tropical climates.
